Description: Laureate head of Maximinus II, right. (obverse)
Mars advancing in military dress right, holding transverse spear, shield & trophy over shoulder. (reverse)
State: Associated with: Roman Empire Ancient Greece and Rome: Roman Empire
Curator's comments: This coin does not feature in the De Salis registers but is documented as forming part of his collection.
Bibliographic references: RIC6 / The Roman Imperial Coinage, vol. 6: from Diocletian's reform (AD 294) to the death of Maximinus (AD 313) (70, p.674)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Maximinus II
Acquisition name: Donated by: Count John Francis William de Salis
